programme.title: Wildest India: Western Ghats: Monsoon Mountains

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Falkland Islands: Penguin Paradise
programme.desc: The Falkland's bleak, battered, and windswept archipelago lies 460 km from the South American mainland. Rugged mountains and expansive pristine coastline are a unique home for wildlife Â– especially for one of the world's most iconic flightless birds.

programme.title: Australia's Wild Places: The Island of the Devil
programme.desc: Just 460,000 people live in Tasmania, an island off the southeast coast of mainland Australia. While its human population is small, the majestic state is rich in natural wonders and is known for its large tracts of pristine wilderness.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Congo: the Untamed Heart
programme.desc: Known for centuries as Africa's Dark Heart, the Congo is a multi-layered, three-dimensional world, seething with innumerable species. By peeling back the layers, we discover how this vast rainforest works, and expose the hidden lives of its inhabitants.

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Malaysia: Freaks of Nature

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Year of the Dog

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Mystery of Mona Lisa

programme.desc: Fuming over Froy's departure, Matt loses his temper on a dominatrix and her client and packs his bags to return to LA.? Down two repo men, the pressure is on Ronnie and Carlos, who interrupts a couple in the middle of their less-than-holy matrimony.

programme.desc: The team wonders what's up with Sonia as she wrestles with Lou's big secret. Ronnie goes undercover and takes a gold-digging RO out on a date, but when Carlos lets the cat out of the bag all hell breaks loose.

programme.desc: Personal choices threaten to railroad Andi's career forever. Danni helps Zac see a light at the end of the tunnel. Karen learns of Aaron's troubled past. (S1, ep16)

programme.desc: Gary swoops in to help Andi. Sabrina helps Maurice prepare for an exciting event. Danni has to decide her feelings about her new situation. (S1, ep18)

programme.title: World's Greatest: Capital Cities
programme.desc: With visionaries, politicians, and activists, these metropolises are defined as the official seats of government. Dublin, Washington, and Taipei share broad avenues, museums, and monuments, but are as varied as the countries they represent.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Glaciers
programme.desc: Clinging to the worldâ€™s highest mountains and forming ice caps on both poles, glaciers leave an impression on the landscape and on all who bear witness to their splendor.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Water Adventures
programme.desc: We are captivated by oceans, rivers, and lakes - the power, the flow, the reflective stillness. And as we seek to get closer, we immerse ourselves in an expanding range of aquatic experiences.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Bridges
programme.desc: A bridge is a structure thatâ€™s designed to transcend, but a great bridge can define the place where it stands. Symbols of human ingenuity, beauty, and grandeur, bridges connect us not only to each other but also to the past.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Wetland Animals
programme.desc: Wetland Animals dives into the swamps, rivers, and flood plains of the Everglades, Botswanaâ€™s Okavango Delta, Kakadu National Park in Australia, and the Amazon to see deadly crocodiles, piranhas, hippopotamus, flamingo, manatee, and platypus.

programme.title: Arthur: Prunella's Special Edition/The Secret Life Of Dogs & Babies
programme.desc: The latest book about everyone's favorite boy wizard--Henry Skreever--is finally out! Every kid in town is lining up to get it, except Prunella, who's ordered a limited edition from England. Ever wonder what Baby Kate and Pal are thinking?

programme.title: Arthur: Three's a Crowd/A is for Angry
programme.desc: Prunella's loves doing yoga with her mom, but when her best friend joins them, will she be able to share her time? When Arthur decides to take on The Brain at a checkers competition, everyone rallies behind the underdog.

programme.title: Arthur: Sue Ellen Moves In/The Perfect Brother
programme.desc: A new girl has arrived in town and no one knows anything about her. And judging by the strange things happening at her house no one wants to know. Then, it's great having a friend spend the weekend.

programme.title: Arthur: Grandpa Dave's Memory Album/Buster's Carpool Catastrophe
programme.desc: Grandpa Dave is moving closer to the family, but something isn't quite right--he's forgetting all sorts of things. And Muffy, Arthur and Buster are carpooling to their cooking class. Can they stop fighting and have fun?

programme.title: Arthur: Two Minutes/Messy Dress Mess
programme.desc: Power shifts in the Tibble household when the twins find out Tommy is two minutes older than Timmy. Ladonna's thrilled when Muffy loans her a beautiful recital dress, but a run-in with a painted bench creates a problem.

programme.title: Arthur: Buster's Green Thumb/My Fair Tommy
programme.desc: Buster finds out that his collection of old food makes excellent compost--which makes for even better tomatoes! Then, neither of the Tibble twins has ever won the coveted "Good Behavior of the Week" cupcake award.

programme.title: Arthur: Sue Ellen Adds It Up/Wish You Were Here
programme.desc: Math, schmath. That's what Sue Ellen thinksâ€¦ until she runs into a problem her artistic vision can't solve. Sue Ellen can't wait to meet her pen pal in person.

programme.title: Arthur: Paradise Lost/The Pride of Lakewood
programme.desc: Baby Kate is growing up! But strangely enough, the more words she learns, the less she seems to understand their dog. To boost school spirit, Arthur and his classmates form the Lakewood Pride Committee, but not everyone wants to join.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's Chicken Pox/Sick As A Dog
programme.desc: The circus is in town and the whole family's excitedâ€”until Arthur gets CHICKEN POX! Will he recover in time? Then, Arthur's worst fears come true when poor, sick Pal has to sleep overnight at the vet's office. Could it be something he did?

programme.title: World War II in HD Color
programme.desc: The Marines succeed in the "island hopping" strategy against suicidal resistance. The US Navy establishes supremacy, cutting off Japan.

programme.title: World War II in HD Color
programme.desc: In 1945, Germany is crumbly on both fronts. The Western Allies cross the Rhine and take most of Germany, while the Red Army quickly advances into Berlin. After Hitler's suicide, Germany surrenders and is divided among the allied powers.

programme.title: World War II in HD Color
programme.desc: Japan continues its suicidal resistance, and invading it looks costly. After 2 atomic bombs, the Emperor intervenes and stops the War. Stalin grabs territory in East Asia. The War is over, and the Atomic Era and the Cold War start.

programme.title: World War II in HD Color
programme.desc: After a careful campaign of disinformation that throws the German defenders off-guard, the Western Allies finally land on Normandy.France is liberated.

programme.title: World War II in HD Color
programme.desc: The Western Allies secure supply routes that will allow them to enter Germany, and the Ardennes counter-offensive fails. The Red Army advances rapidly. The SS implements the Holocaust.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Sunny & Jamison
programme.desc: Sunny is in love with the man of her dreams. Jamison is a model, a TV writer, and also studying to be an anaesthesiologist. However, the pair have never met. Is Jamison too good to be true? (S1, ep1)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: 18-year-old Telizza became bi-curious when her online friendship with Shai turned romantic. Frustrated by several failed attempts to video chat, Telizza has turned to Nev and Max to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Thaddius sought refuge from his struggling marriage through an online relationship with Sara. When she starts telling tales of seizures and kidnappings, he starts to question her identity.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Playing With Fire
programme.desc: In September 2002, two men were found executed in a burning Mercedes in an upscale Hollywood neighborhood. What initially looked like a drug-related murder, turned out to be something entirely different, but the crime scene left little evidence to go on.

programme.title: 48 Hours: A Shot in the Dark
programme.desc: Dr. Richard Illes, a heart surgeon, and his wife, Miriam, were a prominent couple in Williamsport, PA. Then, on Jan. 15, 1999, Miriam was fatally shot as she stood in front of her kitchen window. Investigators think that Richard was responsible.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Guilty Until Proven Innocent
programme.desc: Two men convicted for a brutal rape they say they didnâ€™t commit, and DNA evidence backs them up. How did a law professor, her students and new DNA technology play a part in the case?

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Alternate Suspects
programme.desc: A football coach serves nine years in prison for the murder of his wife before a Texas Court of Criminal Appeals finds he didn't get a fair trial.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Stranger You Know
programme.desc: A report about Marti Hill, who was savagely beaten in her Prairie Village, Kansas home. She was found by police barely breathing and covered in blood.

programme.title: 48 Hours: A Question of Murder
programme.desc: John Maloney, a Wisconsin police officer, was convicted of murdering his estranged wife, Sandy, in 1999. He has always maintained his innocence. After Maloneyâ€™s conviction, the prosecutor, Joe Paulus, pled guilty to accepting bribes to fix over 20 cases

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Execution
programme.desc: Not knowing when, where, or how a dangerous adversary will strike, Jim Phelps and Cinnamon use themselves as human quarries.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Play
programme.desc: With Phelps and Rollin as the leading men, the Impossible Missions Force stages an anti-American play which could prove to be a strong propaganda device for the enemy.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Cardinal
programme.desc: An army commander (played by guest star Theodore Bikel) plots to become dictator by imprisoning an influential cardinal and using a look-alike actor for a public endorsement.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Elixir
programme.desc: The Impossible Missions Force offers a "fountain of youth" to the vain and dictatorial widow (guest star Ruth Roman) of the late president of a small South American country in order to depose her.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Exchange
programme.desc: Cinnamon is captured and the enemy discovers the one thing that would unmask her identity and expose the Impossible Mission Force.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ and Baby Bop decide to get Halloween celebrations underway with a costume party. When Ramon loses his trick-or-treat candy, BJ shares his treats with Ramon.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When several sports balls suddenly disappear without a trace, itâ€™s detective BJ to the rescue as he dons trenchcoat and fedora.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: It's Your Birthday, Barney
programme.desc: Every day with Barney is funâ€”but today is extra special. It's Barney's birthday!

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Once Upon a Fairy Tale
programme.desc: Mario is trying to write his very own fairy tale. The children help by acting out some of their favorite fairy tales to give Mario some ideas.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Stop! Go!
programme.desc: After playing with "Stop" and "Go" signs with Angela, Baby Bop leaves to direct some traffic of her own! Meanwhile, in the caboose, Barney and the kids enjoy a costume parade, a game of "Musical Stop & Go," and some very vigorous body movement.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: It's Hot! It's Cold!
programme.desc: Throughout the day, Barney and the children learn about "hot" and "cold," but the fun really begins when Barney turns the playground into a winter/summer wonderland!

programme.title: Barney and Friends: The Big Garden - Get Happy
programme.desc: Baby Bop wants Barney, BJ and the kids to play with her instead of working in their garden. They promise to play with her as soon as they finish. Baby Bop can't wait, and tries many ways to get them to come play with her now, none of which work.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: My Baby Brother
programme.desc: Barney reminds Baby Bop and BJ that although babies start out little, they grow fast. Through pretend play, favorite songs and fun games, they learn about the many ways we grow every day.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Machine Gun Ton
programme.desc: Ton and Allen battle a pair of vicious female auction hunters who have an axe to grind and bid based on spite rather than strategy. And a gatling gun & suit of armor are worth much less than the guys expected.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: High Flying Ton
programme.desc: A nerdy auction buyer tests Ton and Allen's patience at a big container auction in Ventura. The guys discover a basket and burners for a hot air balloon and a 19th century German single shot rifle!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: You Got Served
programme.desc: After a crushing defeat, the guys leave an auction empty handed and scramble to find new merchandise at a yard sale. But questionable antique tennis rackets and an ancient special effects box may not earn them a cent.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Tough as Nails
programme.desc: CJ seeks to disrupt Allen's search for serenity at a storage auction before the guy's head to a live auction to buy and sell. They uncover an unusual Marilyn Monroe statue, an industrial slip n' slide, and a bed of nails.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: To Pawn or Not To Pawn
programme.desc: On the brink of a major decision, Ton and Allen face-off with Carolyn at an auction in Covina. They win a "special effects unit" that contains big machines for crazy stunt work. The guys decide the fate of the shop.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Quadzilla Attacks!
programme.desc: Extreme Quadzilla ATV, the fastest 4 wheeler ever; a 1910s Remington Derringer and an 1880s Palm Squeezer pistol; revolutionary 1800s Western Electric telephone with a crank dial.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Night of the Digging Dead
programme.desc: A custom-built shark cage; 1900s pathologist's dissection toolkit; 1940s embalming pump and one of the first electric bone saws.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Ton-Geons & Dragons
programme.desc: While Ton soups up their new truck, Allen heads to an auction solo and encounters Carolyn and CJ. There he discovers LARP weaponry, a sword collection, and falconry gear, before Ton reveals their new ride: Betty.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Big Sis Ducks Out
programme.desc: Big Sis drops some bad news as the guys clash with Carolyn over a carnival unit at an auction in Long Beach. Ton and Allen unearth a Native American tomahawk, a dunk tank and a rare gun that can fire three shots at once.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Catch My Drift?
programme.desc: The guys land a custom drift car and a luxury antiques unit that could have a one-of-a-kind pilot pistol from WWI. While trying to track down the provenance of the gun, Ton's lead foot gets them into trouble at their car sale.

programme.desc: Cheyenne gives birth to baby Ace while Catelynn plans a babymoon. Mackenzie's father comes to visit, so she tries to get his health back on track. Gary agrees to go to therapy with Amber. (S9, ep25)
